detaileddescription.para: Boolean indicator for retrograde motion.
Convergence tolerance for the root-finding process.
Maximum number of iterations allowed for the root-finding process.
Boolean flag to indicate whether transformation of input dimensions has already been performed or not.
Calculated parameter to make velocities dimensionless.
NB: This is calculated as a function of specified problem geometry, and therefore not declared const.
Calculated parameter expressing time-of-flight in dimensionless units.
NB: This is calculated as a function of specified problem geometry, and therefore not declared const.
Calculated parameter expressing radius at arrival in dimensionless units.
NB: This is calculated as a function of specified problem geometry, and therefore not declared const.
Calculated parameter expressing chord (norm of difference between both position vectors) in dimensionless units.
NB: This is calculated as a function of specified problem geometry, and therefore not declared const.
Calculated parameter expressing semi-perimeter of the triangle departure position, arrival position and orbit focus in dimensionless units.
NB: This is calculated as a function of specified problem geometry, and therefore not declared const.
Calculated boolean flag to indicate long or short transfer angle between positions.
NB: This is calculated as a function of specified problem geometry, and therefore not declared const.

briefdescription.para: Normalized semi-major axis of minimum energy ellipse.

detaileddescription.para: Calculated parameter expressing the problem's minimum energy ellipse semi-major axis in dimensionless units.
NB: This is calculated as a function of specified problem geometry, and therefore not declared const.
Calculated angle between arrival and departure position.
NB: This is calculated as a function of specified problem geometry, and therefore not declared const.
Calculated parameter necessary for recovering velocities.
NB: This is calculated as a function of specified problem geometry, and therefore not declared const.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Eigen::Vector3d &aCartesianPositionAtDeparture, const Eigen::Vector3d &aCartesianPositionAtArrival, const double aTimeOfFlight, const double aGravitationalParameter, const bool aIsRetrograde=false, const double aConvergenceTolerance=1.0e-9, const int aMaximumNumberOfIterations=50)
memberdef.name: ZeroRevolutionLambertTargeterIzzo

briefdescription.para: Zero revolution Lambert problem constructor for problem definition.

detaileddescription.para:
Constructs a lambert problem with all relevant parameters for a zero revolution problem (i.e. without a full revolution in the solution). Constructor does not compute a solution in order to save on computations; solving is done on first member function call by user.
aCartesianPositionAtDeparture
The initial position in xyz-coordinates. [m]
aCartesianPositionAtArrival
The final position in xyz-coordinates. [m]
aTimeOfFlight
The time-of-flight between the two positions. [s]
aGravitationalParameter
The gravitational parameter of the central body for the computed solution orbit. [m^3/s^2]
aIsRetrograde
A boolean flag to indicate retrograde motion with (default false). [-]
aConvergenceTolerance
The required tolerance for the root solving procedure. [-]
aMaximumNumberOfIterations
The required number of iterations the root solving procedure is allowed to go through (default 50). [-]

Calculates the radial velocity at departure position in S.I. units.
radialVelocityAtDeparture Radial velocity at departure. [m/s]

Calculates and returns transverse velocity at departure position in S.I. units.
transverseVelocityAtDeparture Transverse velocity at departure. [m/s]

Calculates and returns radial velocity at arrival position in S.I. units.
radialVelocityAtArrival Radial velocity at arrival. [m/s]

Calculates and returns transverse velocity at arrival position in S.I. units.
transverseVelocityAtDeparture Transverse velocity at departure. [m/s]

Calculates and returns semi-major axis in S.I. units.
semiMajorAxis Semi-major axis of the problem's solution. [m/s]
Solves the problem using dimensionless parameters by finding the root for the x-paramater and recovering the dimensions of the corresponding orbit parameters.
Checks whether time of flight is positive: if negative, throws an error.
Checks whether gravitational parameter is positive: if negative, throws an error.

briefdescription.para: Transform input to sub results in adimensional units.

detaileddescription.para: Transforms the input to the adimensional units required for the Izzo theory. It also stores relevant (no longer changing) sub results for recovering velocities.

Computes the time-of-flight according to Lagrange's equation as a function of the x-parameter as used by Battin, using the problem's sub results.
xParameter
x-parameter in Izzo's theory.
timeOfFlight Computed dimensionless time-of-flight.

briefdescription.para: Solve the time of flight equation for x.

detaileddescription.para:
Initializes and finds the root of the equation $ 0 = t_f - F( x ) $, where $ F( x ) $ is a function to compute the time-of-flight as a function of $ x $, for a zero revolution solution.
xParameter Computed x parameter.

briefdescription.para: Compute velocities at departure and arrival.

detaileddescription.para:
Computes the inertial departure and arrival velocities according to Izzo's theory and reassigns the dimensions of the input to the velocities.
xParameter
x-parameter in Izzo's theory.

briefdescription.para: Izzo Lambert targeting algorithm class (zero revolution).

detaileddescription.para: Solves the zero revolution Lambert problem using Izzo's algorithms, i.e. the two point boundary value problem of what kind of unperturbed Keplerian orbit connects two positions in a certain time of flight.
This class uses lazy evaluation, solving the algorithm is postponed until the function call relying on the computations.

The algorithm used is based on the algorithm used in Izzo's PyKEP Keplerian toolbox, but is implemented such that only one solution gets computed at a time. The approach from Izzo transforms the problem into dimensionless parameters in terms of the initial position and computes the solution in a 2D plane solving for Battin's x-variable. Contrasting the Izzo approach, the non-dimensionalized parameters are stored internally in order to speed up future recalculations.

parameterdescription.para: For negative time of flight and gravitational parameter values.
When the internal rootfinding algorithm fails to converge within a reasonable amount of iterations.
